metadata.title: CVE-2024-35904 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:selinux: avoid dereference of garbage after mount failure In casekern_mount() fails and returns an error pointer return in the error branchinstead of continuing and dereferencing the error pointer. While on it dropthe never read static variable selinuxfs_mount.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-35904` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-127-generic - 5.15.0-127.137
linux-image-5.15.0-127-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-127.137
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-127-generic - 5.15.0-127.137
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-127-generic-64k - 5.15.0-127.137
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1070-kvm - 5.15.0-1070.75
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1073-aws - 5.15.0-1073.79
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1078-azure - 5.15.0-1078.87
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-127-lowlatency - 5.15.0-127.137
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-127-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-127.137
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1068-nvidia - 5.15.0-1068.69

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1071-oracle - 5.15.0-1071.77
No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-1066-raspi - 5.15.0-1066.69
No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-1039-xilinx-zynqmp - 5.15.0-1039.43
No subscription required

Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
